content.0:
2. Bitcoin falls below $40,000 for first time in 14 weeks; Tesla falls

Bitcoin on Wednesday plunged below $40,000 for the first time in 14 weeks. In fact, the world's biggest cryptocurrency hit a morning low of below $35,000 per unit, an over 46% decline from last month's all-time high near $65,000
content.1:
Media company Overtime has selected Atlanta to host its basketball league that will pay teen players over $100,000 a season. The company is also constructing a new building for the games.

content.2:
Hong Kong (CNN Business) Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies are plunging as anxiety spreads through the market — this time, after China took more steps to crack down on the digital coins.

The world's most heavily traded cryptocurrency plunged as low as $30,202 per coin from a high of nearly $44,000

content.4: There's no single retirement savings number that guarantees you'll have enough money to pay all of your bills. content.14: The pan-European Stoxx 600 slid 1.6% by afternoon deals, with basic resources dropping 3.4% to lead losses as all sectors and major bourses traded firmly in negative territory. BEIJING — The U.S. Treasury said Tuesday it was postponing a ban on trading shares of companies with alleged links to the Chinese military.

The new restrictions take effect June 11, versus the prior date of May 27.
